intro: Cleistes silveirana, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its unique, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cleistes silveirana is considered a species of conservation concern.
